ListSortSortOrder.description: SortOrder defines sort orders to augment sorting operations.

StatusCode.description:
- UNKNOWN: Status_UNKNOWN indicates that a release is in an uncertain state.
 - DEPLOYED: Status_DEPLOYED indicates that the release has been pushed to Kubernetes.
 - DELETED: Status_DELETED indicates that a release has been deleted from Kubermetes.
 - SUPERSEDED: Status_SUPERSEDED indicates that this release object is outdated and a newer one exists.
 - FAILED: Status_FAILED indicates that the release was not successfully deployed.
 - DELETING: Status_DELETING indicates that a delete operation is underway.
 - PENDING_INSTALL: Status_PENDING_INSTALL indicates that an install operation is underway.
 - PENDING_UPGRADE: Status_PENDING_UPGRADE indicates that an upgrade operation is underway.
 - PENDING_ROLLBACK: Status_PENDING_ROLLBACK indicates that an rollback operation is underway.

chartChart.description:
Chart is a helm package that contains metadata, a default config, zero or more
	optionally parameterizable templates, and zero or more charts (dependencies).

dependencies.description: Charts that this chart depends on.

files.description:
Miscellaneous files in a chart archive,
e.g. README, LICENSE, etc.

chartConfig.description: Config supplies values to the parametrizable templates of a chart.

email.title: Email is an optional email address to contact the named maintainer

name.title: Name is a user name or organization name

chartMetadata.description:
Metadata for a Chart file. This models the structure of a Chart.yaml file.

	Spec: https://k8s.io/helm/blob/master/docs/design/chart_format.md#the-chart-file

annotations.description:
Annotations are additional mappings uninterpreted by Tiller,
made available for inspection by other applications.

apiVersion.description: The API Version of this chart.

appVersion.description: The version of the application enclosed inside of this chart.

condition.title: The condition to check to enable chart

deprecated.title: Whether or not this chart is deprecated

description.title: A one-sentence description of the chart

engine.description: The name of the template engine to use. Defaults to 'gotpl'.

home.title: The URL to a relevant project page, git repo, or contact person

icon.description: The URL to an icon file.

maintainers.title: A list of name and URL/email address combinations for the maintainer(s)

sources.title: Source is the URL to the source code of this chart

tags.title: The tags to check to enable chart

tillerVersion.title:
TillerVersion is a SemVer constraints on what version of Tiller is required.
See SemVer ranges here: https://github.com/Masterminds/semver#basic-comparisons

version.title: A SemVer 2 conformant version string of the chart

chartTemplate.description:
Template represents a template as a name/value pair.

By convention, name is a relative path within the scope of the chart's
base directory.

data.description: Data is the template as byte data.

name.description: Name is the path-like name of the template.

chartValue.description: Value describes a configuration value as a string.

type_url.description:
A resource name whose content describes the type of the
serialized data.

hapireleaseStatus.description: Status defines the status of a release.

last_test_suite_run.title: LastTestSuiteRun provides results on the last test run on a release

notes.title: Contains the rendered templates/NOTES.txt if available

resources.description: Cluster resources as kubectl would print them.

delete_policies.title: DeletePolicies are the policies that indicate when to delete the hook

events.description: Events are the events that this hook fires on.

last_run.description: LastRun indicates the date/time this was last run.

path.description: Path is the chart-relative path to the template.

weight.title: Weight indicates the sort order for execution among similar Hook type

Description.description: Description is human-friendly "log entry" about this release.

deleted.description: Deleted tracks when this object was deleted.

releaseRelease.description:
Release describes a deployment of a chart, together with the chart
and the variables used to deploy that chart.

chart.description: Chart is the chart that was released.

config.description:
Config is the set of extra Values added to the chart.
These values override the default values inside of the chart.

hooks.description: Hooks are all of the hooks declared for this release.

info.title: Info provides information about a release

manifest.description: Manifest is the string representation of the rendered template.

name.title: Name is the name of the release

namespace.description: Namespace is the kubernetes namespace of the release.

version.description: Version is an int32 which represents the version of the release.

completed_at.title: CompletedAt indicates the date/time this test suite was completed

results.title: Results are the results of each segment of the test

started_at.title: StartedAt indicates the date/time this test suite was kicked off

releaseTestSuite.title: TestSuite comprises of the last run of the pre-defined test suite of a release version

max.description: The maximum number of releases to include.

v2GetHistoryResponse.description: GetHistoryResponse is received in response to a GetHistory rpc.

v2GetReleaseContentRequest.description: GetReleaseContentRequest is a request to get the contents of a release.

format_values_as_json.title: Format release config and values to JSON string

version.title: Version is the version of the release

v2GetReleaseContentResponse.description: GetReleaseContentResponse is a response containing the contents of a release.

v2GetReleaseStatusRequest.description: GetReleaseStatusRequest is a request to get the status of a release.

name.title: Name is the name of the release

version.title: Version is the version of the release

v2GetReleaseStatusResponse.description: GetReleaseStatusResponse is the response indicating the status of the named release.

info.description: Info contains information about the release.

name.description: Name is the name of the release.

namespace.title: Namesapce the release was released into

v2InstallReleaseRequest.description: InstallReleaseRequest is the request for an installation of a chart.

chart.description: Chart is the protobuf representation of a chart.

chart_url.title: url to download char tar file @appscode

disable_hooks.description: DisableHooks causes the server to skip running any hooks for the install.

dry_run.description:
DryRun, if true, will run through the release logic, but neither create
a release object nor deploy to Kubernetes. The release object returned
in the response will be fake.

name.description:
Name is the candidate release name. This must be unique to the
namespace, otherwise the server will return an error. If it is not
supplied, the server will autogenerate one.

namespace.description: Namepace is the kubernetes namespace of the release.

reuse_name.description: ReuseName requests that Tiller re-uses a name, instead of erroring out.

timeout.description: timeout specifies the max amount of time any kubernetes client command can run.

values.description: Values is a string containing (unparsed) YAML values.

wait.title:
wait, if true, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, and Services are in a ready state
before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as timeout

v2InstallReleaseResponse.description: InstallReleaseResponse is the response from a release installation.

v2ReleaseSummary.description:
ReleaseSummary summaries a deployment of a chart, together with the chart
metadata and the variables used to deploy that chart.

chart_metadata.description: ChartMetadata is the metadata of chart that was released.

config.description:
Config is the set of extra Values added to the chart.
These values override the default values inside of the chart.

info.title: Info provides information about a release

name.title: Name is the name of the release

namespace.description: Namespace is the kubernetes namespace of the release.

version.description: Version is an int32 which represents the version of the release.

disable_hooks.title: DisableHooks causes the server to skip running any hooks for the rollback

dry_run.title: dry_run, if true, will run through the release logic but no create

force.description: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

recreate.title: Performs pods restart for resources if applicable

timeout.description: timeout specifies the max amount of time any kubernetes client command can run.

version.description: Version is the version of the release to deploy.

wait.title:
wait, if true, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, and Services are in a ready state
before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as timeout

v2RollbackReleaseResponse.description: RollbackReleaseResponse is the response to an update request.

v2SummarizeReleasesRequest.description:
SummarizeReleasesRequest requests a list of releases.

Releases can be retrieved in chunks by setting limit and offset.

Releases can be sorted according to a few pre-determined sort stategies.

all.title: if true, list releases with all status codes

filter.description:
Filter is a regular expression used to filter which releases should be listed.

Anything that matches the regexp will be included in the results.

limit.description: Limit is the maximum number of releases to be returned.

namespace.description: Namespace is the filter to select releases only from a specific namespace.

offset.description:
Offset is the last release name that was seen. The next listing
operation will start with the name after this one.
Example: If list one returns albert, bernie, carl, and sets 'next: dennis'.
dennis is the offset. Supplying 'dennis' for the next request should
cause the next batch to return a set of results starting with 'dennis'.

sort_by.description: SortBy is the sort field that the ListReleases server should sort data before returning.

sort_order.description: SortOrder is the ordering directive used for sorting.

status_codes.title: allowed values are UNKNOWN, DEPLOYED, DELETED, SUPERSEDED, FAILED, DELETING

v2SummarizeReleasesResponse.description:
@appscode
SummarizeReleasesResponse is a list of release summaries.

v2UninstallReleaseRequest.description: UninstallReleaseRequest represents a request to uninstall a named release.

disable_hooks.description: DisableHooks causes the server to skip running any hooks for the uninstall.

name.description: Name is the name of the release to delete.

purge.description: Purge removes the release from the store and make its name free for later use.

timeout.description: timeout specifies the max amount of time any kubernetes client command can run.

v2UninstallReleaseResponse.description: UninstallReleaseResponse represents a successful response to an uninstall request.

release.description: Release is the release that was marked deleted.

chart_url.title: url to download char tar file @appscode

disable_hooks.description: DisableHooks causes the server to skip running any hooks for the upgrade.

dry_run.title: dry_run, if true, will run through the release logic, but neither create

force.description: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

recreate.title: Performs pods restart for resources if applicable

reset_values.description: ResetValues will cause Tiller to ignore stored values, resetting to default values.

reuse_values.description:
ReuseValues will cause Tiller to reuse the values from the last release.
This is ignored if reset_values is set.

timeout.description: timeout specifies the max amount of time any kubernetes client command can run.

values.description: Values is a string containing (unparsed) YAML values.

wait.title:
wait, if true, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, and Services are in a ready state
before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as timeout
